JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the Court by Mr Z. Odehnal , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .

On DATE ORG ( okresní soud ) found the applicant guilty of attempted fraud and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment suspended for DATE . The court found it established that the applicant falsified signatures on CARDINAL contracts in order to receive a pre - emption right from the ORG for a certain plot of land .
The applicant appealed arguing , inter alia , that the court had not heard any expert opinion concerning the authenticity of the signatures .

On DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) upheld the applicant ’s conviction but changed the sentence to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment suspended for DATE finding the possible damage to the ORG to be considerably lower than that found by ORG . The court further held that the signatures on the contract were so significantly different compared to real signatures of the persons concerned that an expert opinion was not necessary .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) rejected the applicant ’s appeal on points of law as manifestly ill - founded . The court noted that the applicant had been aware that the signatures were not authentic and thus if the contracts had been considered valid the ORG would have suffered a damage . The applicant thus acted with dolus eventualis .

The applicant lodged a constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) claiming a violation of his right to a fair trial and the principle of no punishment without law . He complained , inter alia , that no mens rea to commit an offence had been proved and that the courts did not admit in evidence an expert opinion regarding the authenticity of the signatures . ORG ( GPE PERSON ) requested observations from the ordinary courts . ORG , ORG and ORG only shortly referred to their decisions and maintained that they had already dealt with the complaints raised by the applicant . None of these observations were communicated to the applicant .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s constitutional appeal as manifestly ill - founded . As to the fact that it had not communicated the other parties’ observations to the applicant , it noted that it did not take them into account as they did not bring anything new .
The relevant domestic law and practice concerning the procedure before ORG are set out in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG and Others v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINALV ) .
